headers.confirmAllDelete: Are you sure you want to clear All app data?

settings.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete the save?

addDevice.deviceHashHelp: Enter or select your device PrefabHash or PrefabName.
addDevice.deviceNameHelp: Enter the device name as you would do with @:labeller
addDevice.devicePortHelp: Select the pin to which the device is assigned on the IC or leave empty
addDevice.deviceIdHelp: Enter device id or leave it empty.

tutorial.title: Tutorial
tutorial.description:
Welcome to the Stationeers Code Simulator tutorial.
Let's go through the controls step by step.

fileMenu.title: File menu
fileMenu.description: Save, export, or load an IC code and its associated devices from this menu.

save.title: Save
save.description:
Save the current code in the browser memory.
For a new code, use the next button (@:control.saveAs).

saveAs.title: @:control.saveAs
saveAs.description:
Save a new code in the browser memory and assign it a name.
Additionally, this button provides the option to export your code and devices to your local machine or generate a shareable link.

open.title: @:control.open
open.description: Open an IC code from a file, restore a previously exported code, or open it from a shared link.

load.title: @:control.load
load.description: List and access all saved codes in the browser memory.

share.title: @:control.share
share.description: Generate and copy a link to share your IC code and simulation environment settings.

iCSimulation.title: IC Simulation
iCSimulation.description:
Here you can add devices to your simulation environment.
Let's see it in details.

manualControls.title: Manual controls
manualControls.description: Clear all registers and reset the execution to the first line, simulating removing and placing back the IC chip.

addDevice.title: @:control.addDevice
addDevice.description: Once the device is configured, click here to add it into your simulation environment.

labeler.title: @:labeller
labeler.description:
Similar to the game, assign a distinct name to each device.
This enables the simulation of batch named commands.

pinD0-D5.title: Pin d0-d5
pinD0-D5.description: Or simply determine the pin to which the device will connect.

deviceID.title: Device ID
deviceID.description:
Optionally, specify a ReferenceID for use with ld, sd, putd, or getd instructions.
You can locate this ID in-game using a Configuration card on your tablet.

converter.title: Converter
converter.description: Generate a Hash using the CRC32 function from a name, as used in Stationeers.

codeEditor.title: Code editor
codeEditor.description: Here, you can either write your IC code or copy-paste existing code.

registersView.title: Registers view
registersView.description: Monitor and manually adjust all registers during the simulation.

constantsView.title: Constants view
constantsView.description: Access a list of default constants defined by the IC10, along with labels (line number) or constants specified within your code.

errorLog.title: Error log
errorLog.description: Any code execution errors will be recorded here.

simulationEnvironment.title: Simulation environment
simulationEnvironment.description: Each device added to the environment is represented by a card, providing a visual overview of your setup.

devicePrefabName.title: Device PrefabName
devicePrefabName.description: This is the device type as defined by the Stationpedia.

deviceName.title: Device Name
deviceName.description: Review the custom name assigned to the device using the @:labeller.

pinsAndAliases.title: Pins and aliases
pinsAndAliases.description: Check all pins and aliases associated with the device in your code.

deviceProperties.title: Device properties
deviceProperties.description: Access properties generated from the configured device, including its Reference ID, Prefab name, and Labelled name.

deviceVariables.title: Device Variables
deviceVariables.description: Monitor and edit variables and their values set by the code, with the option to manually add new variables from a list.

slots.title: Slots
slots.description: Each slot of the device is displayed, allowing you to edit slot variables by clicking on them.

remove.title: @:remove
remove.description: Use this option to remove a device from the simulation environment.

delete.title: @:delete
delete.description:
Click here to reset everything and start with a fresh simulation.
Be aware that this action will also erase all your saved codes!

step.title: @:control.step
step.description: Execute one step of the code manually.

goto.title: @:control.toYield
goto.description: Execute all instructions from the current line to the next yield instruction.

reset.title: @:control.reset
reset.description: Clear all registers and reset the execution to the first line, simulating removing and placing back the IC chip.

tutorial.end_confirm: Are you sure you want to end the tutorial?

pin_device.title: Pin device
pin_device.description: Attach the device to the screen so that it is always at hand

instructions.title: Instructions
instructions.description: List of all instructions available in the IC10, click on this button OR press <key>F1</key> to open the instructions list.

row.title: Instruction
row.description: You can see the instruction and preview here

row-opened.title: Instruction row expand
row-opened.description: You can click on the line to toggle the display of the detailed description.
